snippet: A federal prosecutor told the jury that John C. Liu, a Democratic candidate for New York City mayor, had to have been aware of a scheme to use straw donors for Mr. Liu’s campaign.
abstract: Federal prosecutor asks jury to convict Jia Hou and Xing Wu Pan, former associates of John C Liu, New York City comptroller and mayoral candidate, of conspiring to funnel money to his campaign through an illegal fund-raising scheme;  prosecutor also argues that Liu had to have been aware of scheme.
lead_paragraph: A federal prosecutor told the jury that John C. Liu, a Democratic candidate for New York City mayor, had to have been aware of a scheme to use straw donors for Mr. Liu’s campaign.

headline.seo: Liu Is Prominent Figure in Prosecutor’s Closing Arguments at Ex-Aides’ Trial
headline.main: Liu Is Prominent Figure in Closing Argument at Ex-Aides’ Trial
headline.print_headline: Liu Is Prominent Figure in Closing Argument at Ex-Aides’ Trial
